docs.title: Employee Management System
docs.text: Welcome to the Employee Management System documentation. This documentation provides an overview of the system, setup instructions, usage guidelines, and API references.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• List all employees
  • View employee details
  • Add a new employee
  • Edit an existing employee
  • Delete an employee

docs.title: employee_list
docs.text:
• URL: /
  • Method: GET
  • Description: Displays a list of all employees.

docs.title: employee_detail
docs.text:
• URL: /employee/<int:pk>/
  • Method: GET
  • Description: Displays the details of a specific employee.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/2arry/employee_management.git
cd employee_management

  2. Create a virtual environment and activate it: 

    python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows use `venv\Scripts\activate`

  3. Install the required packages: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

  4. Set up the MySQL database:

    • Create a database named employee_db.
    • Update the database settings in employee_management/settings.py with your MySQL credentials.

  5. Apply the migrations: 

    python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate

  6. Create a superuser to access the Django admin interface: 

    python manage.py createsuperuser

  7. Run the development server: 

    python manage.py runserver

  8. Open your web browser and navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/ to access the application.

docs.title: Building the Documentation
docs.text:
1. Install MkDocs and the Material theme: 

    pip install mkdocs-material

  2. Serve the documentation locally to preview it: 

    mkdocs serve

  3. Open your web browser and navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/ to view the documentation.

  4. To build the static site: 

    mkdocs build

  5. To deploy the documentation to GitHub Pages: 

    mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Employee List
docs.text:
• The main page displays a list of all employees.
  • You can add a new employee by clicking the "Add New Employee" link.
  • Each employee has links to view details, edit, and delete.

docs.title: Employee Detail
docs.text: • Click on an employee's name to view their details.

docs.title: Add/Edit Employee
docs.text:
• Fill out the form to add or edit an employee.
  • Click "Save" to submit the form.

docs.title: Delete Employee
docs.text:
• Click the "Delete" link next to an employee to delete them.
  • Confirm the deletion on the next page.

docs.title: Admin Interface
docs.text:
• Navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ and log in with the superuser credentials.
  • You can manage employees from the admin interface as well.

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
1. To run the tests, use the following command: 

    python manage.py test

  2. Ensure all tests pass before deploying the application.
